column4: Learnt to fly FFighter, if u want to share a printer, use samba...

kind of, I will be connecting to this printer for testing purposes, I have some ruby pritning logic that needs to connect to a printer, and as I don't have a real printer, I just need to connect to a similar API, hence the PDF printer
IO.popen('path/to/device')
open office can do that... but not sure if how u can do it with ur program though... let me check that

k... first sudo apt-get install cups-pdf
yes, have done that already :)
Add a new printer (System->Administration->Printing) selecting the “Local Printer” “PDF Printer” option. In the next step choose “Generic Printer” and then used the “Postscript Color” driver.

k... try it hope it works!

one more thing... dont forget to restart cups.... sudo /etc/init.d/cupsys restart
check that in System->Administration->Printing
where u add the printer...
